channel.title: CSS question

item.title: CSS question
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

[quote=“iwasinmoparseas101class, post:1, topic:60390”]Hey everyone, designing a website…can’t figure out how to position objects in CSS. I looked it up on google, read a couple tuts but it’s not working for me:

I’m trying to get the mp3player to the bottom right of the page. Any help would be appreciated[/quote]

I don’t understand what you are trying to do. Are you trying to make it so it doesn’t move when you scroll? Because you are only doing that to ‘

Get Macromedia’s Flash Player to see this player.

’. You need to either get rid of that or attach the id to the object instead.

[quote=“Cabby, post:2, topic:60390”]Well to get text at the bottom you could use

p { text-align: bottom; }

And maybe even (if it works)

p { text-align: bottom; left; } [/quote]

No. Get rid of that “OFFERING HELP TO ANYONE WITH WEB DESIGN!” from your sig.

Read full topic

item.title: CSS question
item.dc:creator: @Cabby Cabby
item.description:
@Cabby wrote:

Well to get text at the bottom you could use

p { text-align: bottom; }

And maybe even (if it works)

p { text-align: bottom; left; }

item.title: CSS question
item.dc:creator: @iwasinmoparseas101cl iwasinmoparseas101class
item.description:
@iwasinmoparseas101cl wrote:

Hey everyone, designing a website…can’t figure out how to position objects in CSS. I looked it up on google, read a couple tuts but it’s not working for me:


<style type="text/css">
#position{
	position: fixed;
 	width: auto;
	height: auto;
	top: 15%;
	right: 0;
	bottom: 0;
	left: 90%;
}


</style>

</head>


<body background="./Pictures/tg&tf800x1054.jpg">

<div id="position">
<p>
<p id="player2"><a href="http://www.macromedia.com/go/getflashplayer">Get Macromedia's Flash Player</a> to see this player.</p>
<object width="300" height="200">
<param name="movie" value="mp3player.swf">
<embed src="mp3player.swf" width="300" height="200">
</embed>
</object>
</p>
</div>

I’m trying to get the mp3player to the bottom right of the page. Any help would be appreciated

Read full topic
